metadata.title: CVE-2016-9950 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Apport before 2.20.4. There is a path traversalissue in the Apport crash file "Package" and "SourcePackage" fields. Thesefields are used to build a path to the package specific hook files in the/usr/share/apport/package-hooks/ directory. An attacker can exploit thispath traversal to execute arbitrary Python files from the local system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9950` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.4').
